website_summaries.verdict: Best-tasting vitamin for infants and toddlers who can't chew.
pros: Each drop is loaded with iron
Parents rave that these drops taste good
Babies and toddlers readily swallow them
OK for vegans and those who keep kosher
Don't need to be refrigerated after opening
cons: Can stain a little one's clothing, although the marks can be removed

customer_reviews.title: Successfully Taking His Vitamins!!
customer_reviews.text: The pediatrician told us to get a multivitamin with iron for our 6 month old. The only one available at our local Walgreens was the Zarbee's naturals baby multivitamin with iron. He HATED the taste of it; it made him gag. Plus, the dosage is 2 mL. I just received the NovaFerrum and he swallowed it all first try! Didn't even make a face! I also like that it's only 1 mL, rather than 2. A++++, am definitely buying again once we've gone through this bottle. ******* Update: 3 months later: My baby is still taking these successfully. Doesn't make a face, swallows it easily. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Y

customer_reviews.title: Great, but....
customer_reviews.text: This does not have vitamin C in it. Iron is uptaken easier by the body if it has vitamin C to go along with it. So, I have to mix this with orange juice and give it to my toddler so the iron in the vitamin does not go to waste. Also, it does not taste very good, so the juice really covers the taste as well. But, it's good quality, so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken or stupid dropper design
customer_reviews.text: Opened it up and realized the cap for the dropper is missing the part that would attach/screw on to the bottle. There is nothing else in the box that would make it possible. Now what am I supposed to do with this? Ordered a replacement. Will update review once I receive the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Georgie Sac

customer_reviews.title: High iron/constipation
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it grape flavour and looks forward to taking her vitamins. But because of the high iron content it gave her a really bad dose of constipation. Do not give as a daily vitamin unless prescribed by pediatrician. Works perfect except for the very bad constipation effect. Gave it 1 star cause it's a better chance someone will read this warning than a 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Terrible = 2019 Change of Dropper Removal from Cap
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought this product many times, but the recent change that removed the convenient dropped attached to the bottle lid, to a cheesy, cheap, desperate dropper that leaks and will you have dropping staining vitamin juice everywhere is absolutely idiotic (clearly a corporate suit move to save money, or rather make more, at the expense of the customers and their experience). As such, they’ve lost this customer, I recommend you look at other options because of how poorly this packaging is designed due to the recent change (first seen in April 2019, prior bottle with dropper in the cap/lid worked great).
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Foil seal breaking apart into liquid.
customer_reviews.text: We always buy this because my daughter likes the taste and dislikes the taste of most multivitamins with iron. We have ordered multiple times and never had an issue. However, this most recent bottle had a foil seal that ended up breaking up all through the liquid. I typically puncture and remove most of the center that comes off easily. I only noticed when giving my daughter the dropper and noticed foil on the end of the dropper! The expiration isn’t until 2021 so it’s not an old bottle. No idea why the foil is coming apart this way. I recommend removing every piece of the seal if you purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: My one year old says it's gross
customer_reviews.text: I didn't try this product but my one year old refused to take this after just one dose. She would hold her lips shut super tight when she saw me coming with it. Try something else!
customer_reviews.author: Zumba fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Great liquid multivitamin with iron!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous infant multivitamins with iron!! My premature son needs to take daily multivitamins with iron, but kept spitting out the nasty Poly-Vi-Sol stuff given to us by the NICU after he was discharged. No matter how little I gave him, he still spit it out (or opened his mouth and let it dribble out--very messy and gross). But this multivitamin formula is something he tolerates fine. I am grateful and happy to have found it! I will be using it for him indefinitely--and have recommended it on my preemies Facebook group.
customer_reviews.author: L. Quick

customer_reviews.title: Nice supplememt
customer_reviews.text: Such a great iron supplement for a child. It has the iron but doesn't taste or smell terrible. It will, however, stain because of the iron in it, so make sure you wipe a small child's mouth or have the child drink water after taking the vitamin dose so the iron doesn't ruin clothes or sheets. Even if the iron does get on clothes or sheets, it is a much lighter color than competitor iron products so that's a bonus. There is an easy to use squeeze dropper enclosed and the flavor is quite pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: My picky son even take this and I love it is all natural!
customer_reviews.text: My son takes it, so the taste must be ok and I love all ingredients are all natural. At first, I thought it contain artificial ingredient, but the company let me know that all are natural. I appreciate this safe product and the company is watching what we think about this product.
customer_reviews.author: be a healthy puppy

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like it because of all of the good reviews but my daughter would get very constipated and scream and cry in pain afterwards for the following day. I stopped using for a week and then it happened again. Waited another week or more, tried it again and same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Trayer

customer_reviews.title: Tastes terrible to me, toddler has no qualms
customer_reviews.text: My toddler does not express herself in complete sentence or anything, so I can't get a real meaningful review from her, but she doesn't refuse the dropper when it is vitamin time. Was recommended by our doctor to resolve slightly low levels of iron, and it has elevated her iron levels. Doc also recommended because "it tastes better than other iron supplements on the market". It's no Flintstone vitamin, but it's quite possible the vitamins from my childhood were simply sugar pills–I don't think the FDA regulated multi-vitamins until the mid 90s.
customer_reviews.author: John the Leprechaun

customer_reviews.title: Best natural  Option at the moment
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Does not stink like other multivitamins with Iron. Form of Iron is more gentle on babies intestines CONS: Monk fruit similar to stevia tricks the pancreas stimulates insulin secretion This product does not have polysorbate 80 like enfamil. This product will stain clothing. Overall I recomend this and will buy again. I hope Novaferrum stops using Monk fruit or offers a separate product with no added sweetners
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great multivitamin. I haven’t tried it to see what ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great multivitamin. I haven’t tried it to see what it tastes like but my son has no qualms about taking it. This is my second bottle. After the first, I tried PolyViSol. He didn’t seem to like it as much but would take it anyway. Occasionally he would spit up, however, I noticed he started getting a rash. After eliminating various things, it seems as though it was the PolyViSol. So if you’re comparing the two, like I was, I highly recommend NovaFerrum. The only negative is that my second bottle arrived sealed in the plastic, however seemed quite a bit low (1”). Unfortunate seeing as though it’s $20.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Taste Bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because supposedly many of the reviewers say their child loves this product. Yet my son hates the taste! I tried it myself and it taste like metal--not good at all. I put it in his water so he will at least get some of the multivitamin but it's not a full dose daily. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: The good, the bad, and the ugly:
customer_reviews.text: GOOD: It tastes and smells good and my baby had no trouble with it. BAD: I feel it goes too fast, and the dropper would always want to come apart from the handle. UGLY: While Vitamin C might not be needed to absorb this iron, per the manufacturer, C is a great great vitamin to have in the body. High levels have shown to really boost immunity and support overall health and keep things at bay. Not having it at all is a no go for me and I've found a better option. Plus, my kid gets enough iron in meat and I think it's backing him up.
customer_reviews.author: cheluzal

customer_reviews.title: Yuck
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yr old is a picky eater (on the spectrum), so I needed to get a vitamin with iron. His levels have not been tested, so I'm not sure whether this actually works or not. I can tell you that this vitamin tastes awful. The aftertaste reminds me of when you bite your tongue or the inside of your cheek and it starts bleeding. Gross. It's actually hard to cover the taste up, but I just give my son water to chug after he takes it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnielynn

customer_reviews.title: My son takes likes it
customer_reviews.text: This is the first and only iron and multivitamin that my son has taken. I started giving it when he was 6 months and never stopped since I think is always good (he is 2 1/2 now). He never had problems taking it. Also, I remember when I bought it the first time that some reviews mentioned stains on teeth, I never had this problem. I used to clean his teeth with a teeth wipe when he was a baby, and now I just make hi drink a sip of water. Maybe that helped. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Gimena

customer_reviews.title: Not vegan
customer_reviews.text: This product is NOT VEGAN See below response from company when I contacted them for more info on D3 source as they now have a different product, Delish which clearly states it contains plant based D3. Hello, Thank you for your email. The ingredient can be considered Vegan which is the case of the Vitamin D-3 as Cholecalciferol in MCT as it comes from the oil of lambswool. From the oil, they extract the proteins which produce the D-3.
customer_reviews.author: slgonen

customer_reviews.title: Great option for our baby
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our 9 month old daughter after the doctor told us she needed more iron. So far, she loves these drops. She gets excited when its time to take this. The only down side is that the liquid is a very dark brown and could stain items very easily. You have to be careful not to drip. As a few others have mentioned, the dropper included also kinda sucks, but still works. Update: We are now on our 4th order of these. The product is great, the little dropper still sucks. I will continue to purchase this product because it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Discomfort and GI changes after repeated use.
customer_reviews.text: It started off working really well it seemed. My 3 month old’s labs showed adequate vitamin levels after taking this for 3 weeks. However in the 4th week she became extremely fussy, constipated and gassy. Although we discontinued use she has since been on a nursing strike every other day and is still having GI discomfort and different smelling stools than usual 2 weeks later (she’s a bf baby). The taste was very Medicine like and she gags immediately, throwing half it up after consuming.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredients and flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I opted to order this brand oppose to the competitor brand and I'm glad I did! My daughter has no problems with this multi-vitamin unlike the other which she really disliked! Her iron levels are currently low so hopefully this gets us where we need to be. I add 1mL to 1 bottle a day. Also, ingredients are great and all natural. Will be purchasing this over and over again!
customer_reviews.author: FTMAT35

customer_reviews.title: My Toddler Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: The package came super fast. Everything was well packaged, no spills or broken seals. Thought I’d give it a little try because I try everything before giving it to my kids. Personally, I can taste every bit of iron in it with an after taste of grape. But when I gave it to my 2 year old son he ate it with no problems and even said “mmm yummy!” afterwards. Since he’s the one that’ll be taking it, I guess it’s a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Stuff D

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 week old was put on multivitamin w/ iron by her doctor. Sent home with the usual recommendation & it was awful. Baby seemed to gag & choke on it, even going rigid when I'd try to get her to take it. Found this & decided to try it... great decision!!! She now gets this supplement & has no issues taking it! The flavor clearly makes a difference to mask the horrible iron taste. SO glad this is available!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually tastes good!!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE perfect supplement for an infant/toddler needing supplementation with iron. Unlike some others on the market, this supplement doesn't taste like total crap. My son threw up his other supplement every time we attempted to give it to him. He was initially diagnosed microcytic anemic, so we absolutely needed to get supplemental iron into him. After several times of being thrown up on, I ordered NovaFerrum. My 14 month old son takes it willingly and WITHOUT throwing up. I've already ordered a second bottle and will continue using this supplement until he is old enough to use chewables. I highly recommend it to any parent not wanting to torture their child with hideously flavored liquid supplements.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Evans

customer_reviews.title: My son hates it
customer_reviews.text: This product is really thick and my son hates it. He refuses to take it and when he does we have to give him a drink because he cries afterwards he is 3. I thought I picked a good flavor but no. Also the product cost to much for the size that you receive. If your child is a picky eater do not waste your money they will fight you on taking it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard16

customer_reviews.title: Messy disaster waiting to happen; need better packaging
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose but it is insanely dark. My daughter has no issue taking it straight from the dropper but that means the bottle is wide open while dispensing the liquid so of course without fail it got knocked over and went all over the place. The color made it impossible to get out of the rug. They really should design the top similar to infant Tylenol where you put the syringe in instead of a dropper top considering how much of a mess this stuff is.
customer_reviews.author: K. Salerno

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for putting the built in dropper back!!!
customer_reviews.text: we have been using this product for 2 years and love it!!!! Thank you for keeping the built in dispenser which helps w mess and makes traveling w the drops easy!
customer_reviews.author: spring

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best multivitamin with iron supplement for babies! I originally used the Enfamil Poly whatever you get at the grocery store and my 4 week old daughter gagged for 20 minutes after I attempted to give it to her. I found this due to reviews on Amazon and she LOVES it. She's now a year old and I still give it to her. She looks forward to taking it. My only complaint would be the staining... it will stain and I get nervous it will stain her teeth so I rub her teeth with a wet paper towel afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Only iron my toddler will take
customer_reviews.text: I no longer have to fight my toddler to get this into him! The previous multi vitamin + iron was so hard for him to take down, we were dreading giving it to him every day. With this one, he actually LIKES the taste and willingly opens his mouth. I showed it to his pediatrician and she was fine with it. Great product. We've already bought it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Macbeth

customer_reviews.title: Kinder to your baby to just throw your $20 in the trash.
customer_reviews.text: I was only ever forcefully able to give one dose of this, so here I am throwing $20 in the trash. My baby hates it. He recognizes what it is when I try to sneak him a dose and flat out refuses it. Any that makes it past his lips, he spits out immediately. It would be much more efficient if it could be condensed somehow so a single dose wasn’t such a high volume of liquid since it tastes disgusting. “Yum!” is false advertisement. I tasted it and I agree with my baby, it really is nasty and the aftertaste is very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for picky eaters
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old son is a SUPER picky eater (I know, surprising) so supplementing vitamins are necessary. He HATED the gummies so I was skeptical about him being ok with liquid vitamins. I pretty much anticipated holding him down to force him to take these but to my surprise he loves it! Every night I say "vitamins" and he comes running! The price is high but you get about 2 months from it and honestly I'll pay whatever I need to to make sure he's getting enough vitamins.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not sure its really helping my sons iron levels..
customer_reviews.text: The product smells and tastes a lot better then the enfamil poly vi sol however my son still wont take it and im convinced its not really helping my son who has low iron.. and for the price it should definitely be helping his iron levels. We go to the doctors tomorrow so we will see and ill update
customer_reviews.author: Jamiiee

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old doesn't complain about taking it
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this one. My two year old, although not excited by taking vitamins, doesn't complain about this one. Another brand we tried smelled like crushed Flintstone vitamins (at least my memory as a kid of those) and I could understand her extreme displeasure at taking that one. Very glad one of the nurses at our pediatrician office recommended this one. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Aztec Becca

customer_reviews.title: A little spendy but still a great vitamin for an infant!
customer_reviews.text: We were advised by our pediatrician to give our daughter an iron supplement starting at 6 months to prevent anemia. This is the only vitamin she's had but my daughter loves the taste of this. At her 9 month appointment the doc said her iron levels are great so it definitely works as intended! My only complaint is that it's a little spendy when you really only get 50 doses out of it that's $20 every 50 days or about $150 a year 😲.
customer_reviews.author: DanaStacy

customer_reviews.title: multivitamin kids will want to take
customer_reviews.text: My 11 month daughter was seeming weak while weaning from nursing, and was really disliking the vitamin D supplement I was giving her (which also had a terrible smell and aftertaste), so I decided to try NovaFerrum. She takes them without any fuss, and I have noticed she's been looking more lively and healthy. I got 2 boxes, amd will be sticking with this multivitamin.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Our kid loves this!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to give our child a vitamin containing iron as he wasn't eating enough meat/vegetables early in his foray into "real food". The first brand we tried tasted terrible (we tried it also) and created some tension with him as well as between us. The NovaFerrum has been great, he now requests vitamins every evening and loves the taste. It's great to know he's getting the nutrition he needs and also enjoys the taste of them. We've set up a subscription so we always have some in the house.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Good for vegan/plant based - B12 and Fe
customer_reviews.text: We're pretty solidly plant based and needed to find a multivitamin for our one year old. This has been one of the only ones that include B12 and iron (the main two our pediatrician recommended). Our daughter doesn't seem to mind the taste at all.
customer_reviews.author: M.Brezler

customer_reviews.title: He takes it!
customer_reviews.text: It took a few days for my toddler to get used to it. I used to chase him around to feed it to him and he would knock it off my hand. Be careful, it will stain clothes. Now, he takes it with no problem. He opens his mouth automatically when I put the spoon towards his mouth. I use the dropper to measure 1 mL and then squeeze it onto the spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting
customer_reviews.text: My daughter HATES the taste. She gagged and screamed the entire time. I bought this to try after my doctor recommended starting a multivitamin with iron because it said it tastes great. This is completely false. Won’t be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Buschur

customer_reviews.title: Poor lid design - bring back the screw on dropper!
customer_reviews.text: They changed the lid and now the cardboard insert falls apart every time I take the lid off! Please bring back the screw on dropper!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old absolutely loves these vitamins so much so that she was upset I wouldn’t give her more. This is a dark liquid so you have to use caution when administering. I got some on a white shirt, but immediately was able to wash it out with some dish soap. These don’t have the funky smell that some vitamins have and the ingredients are what I was looking for, for my LO. Please like if this review was helpful :)
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Tastes good
customer_reviews.text: Cant comment on the absorbency yet but my lil one loves the taste . He has low hb level and his pediatrician wanted to start some irin supplement. We did buy another one feom the local pharmacy before trying this and he hated the taste . This was recommended by my friend and voila ... it’s unbelievable how he loves the taste of this iron supplement. Relieved mom !!
customer_reviews.author: Abe kap

customer_reviews.title: NOT the magic med it's made out to be
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes based on some other reviewers saying that their kid loves the flavor, took it no problem. Yeah, not really. Not as bad as the straight-up, unflavored stuff, but still hard to get down a toddler's throat. Since it cost $20 I'm not giving up yet... Maybe if mixed in some prune juice or something it will be tolerable. The point is, it still smells and tastes very strongly of B vitamins and iron. My son still gagged and spit it down his bib.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M

customer_reviews.title: Good source of multivitamin and Iron
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th bottle that I bought. My son is very picky with flavor. This is the only one vitamin that he takes. I’m not quite sure about pros or cons, but I guess It’s good for him to gets proper Iron each day. Since my son doesn’t has any bad effect from this vitamin, so, I would recommend to others parents too
customer_reviews.author: Thanjira

customer_reviews.title: Great taste but causes diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: Our pediatrician recommended for our 12 month old as she is a very picky eater. She loves the taste but it gives her serious diarrhea. We thought it was a fluke at first so we quit giving it to her until her diarrhea cleared up. Gave it to her again and it started right back up. Definitely won’t be giving her anymore. :(
customer_reviews.author: Linkinhoker Family

customer_reviews.title: Your child will take this vitamin.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was a micro preemie and she has a hard time eating any vitamin without gagging and is incredibly picky. She hates hard vitamins, gummies and liquids. Although she does not like the taste of this vitamin it is the only Vitamin I can get her to swallow and that is huge for her. So overall it's a success and if my daughter will take it there is 99.9% chance your child will at least take it because my daughter is the pickiest child I've ever seen plus has some real eating issues on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Customer A

customer_reviews.title: Please Stay away!! Save your money by any means!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst multivitamin ever, I bought this a few days ago, started giving it to my picky eater (toddler he is 3 years old ) i would put it in his juice, after 3 days using it: he’s been having diarrhea for 4 days now. He keeps goin every half hour, stomach aches, everything he eats keeps coming out, i stoped using it immediately, i will never again buy it. I even had to take my son to his pediatrician.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Tried It
customer_reviews.text: I tried it and thought this is gross it tastes like iron I wouldn't wanna give this to my baby. 1st time I gave it to him he made a nasty face but [*UPDATE] here we are in april &he loves it. Just takes some getting used to! I'm about to purchase another bottle I cant find any other vitamins with decent reviews. We haveny had any negative side effects.
customer_reviews.author: Savonne Castro-Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed at best
customer_reviews.text: Bought this vitamin for my daughter and it's not practical. if any spills whatever it touches is stained. In now have stained pajamas, blankets and shirts. Even a little drop stains. Also,she hates it. She spits it out and makes a face every time. I wish this came in a colorless option and unflavored to add to good or bottle.
customer_reviews.author: kristin

customer_reviews.title: Good liquid vitamins with iron
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for liquid vitamins with iron for my 3 year old. These are what I found. They smell a little bad and are very dark in color, but he doesn't whine or fuss when I give them to him. They do stain though, if you drip them on the counter or on clothing, so be careful. Also, we use a different syringe than the one that came in the bottle. It would not be sanitary to use the dropper attached to the cap to put the medicine in your child's mouth and then stick it back in the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: cmanning3

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3-yr old daughter. She is a very picky eater and eats only certain things. Plus she never seems to be hungry. Her stool was pale yellow color forever and her doctor recommended we start her on a multivitamin with iron. We tried multiple gummies but she refuses to take them. She is not really that impressed with the flavor of this liquid but takes it every day. And I must say she started to ask for more food. Not sure if that is a effect of this but that is what I noticed in this first week of taking this supplement. I would recommend it and will purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: ALMA T.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that there isnt anything in it I can't pronounce! I bought this product because my fussy eating 4 year old was border line anemic. I used the product for 3 months as directed and his iron levels didn't go up but also didn't go down- I'm now doing 2 droppers full once a day and we will recheck iron levels again in 3 months cross your fingers :) I did have to mix it into my sons juice because he being the fussy eater he is didn't like it straight from the dropper but other than that I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: lightbar

customer_reviews.title: Danger!!!Don’t Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Danger!!!Do not buy this!!!My baby is using this multivitamins two days now and I notice he’s waking up in the middle of the night scratching his face, neck and back.I just read online this afternoon that one of the side effect is rash/itching.I wouldn’t recommend this multivitamins!
customer_reviews.author: Marco Angelo Soriano

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased and discarded several pediatric multivitamins and this one is a keeper! Let's be honest, most taste like chalk and blood. I can't blame my one year old for making a fuss and spitting it out because I try everything I give her myself. This brand isn't bad at all! It's not particularly enjoyable to consume but my one year old will actually take it so that makes it a winner in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tasty iron supplement
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended Polyvisol for my 12-month olds iron deficiency and loss of appetite, at first she was throwing it up, and then just trying to spit it out; she hated that stuff. She loves novaferrum though, and I feel like her appetite has been finally picking up after only a few days of switching.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie Dinsmore

customer_reviews.title: My son can't even taste the difference...YESSS!!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old is as picky as it gets and refuses EVERYTHING, feeding time is torture, never mind supplements and medications. I read all the reviews and thought I'd give this a try and I'm so glad I did. I'm so amazed my son actually takes this on a daily basis and has no idea! I definitely recommend this to all those kidos in need of supplements and have refused all other options (like my son did).
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Z

customer_reviews.title: Iron that my baby actually takes willingly!
customer_reviews.text: I've always struggled with getting my kids to take medications/supplements, but this one must actually taste good because she takes it willingly since she was 8 months old (now 18 months). I do give it to her in the bath as it does stain clothes. The smell is off putting to me but doesn't seem to bother her at all.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Taste is very very strong. Toddler disapproved.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these vitamins after already having tried gummies & chocolate ones. But my 2 1/2 yr old will not take them because of the taste. He’s very good with droppers & liquids but he squished his lips together whenever I try to give it to him. The taste is very very strong, like liquified flintstones and chemicals. Now I’m out another $20, and still need to find other vitamins 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caused horrible constipation
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my son and he loved the taste. Unfortunately he became extremely constipated for days after taking this. I waited a few days before giving him the vitamins again just to be sure that was the issue (hes never had digestive issues until taking this vitamin) and sure enough, he became severely constipated again. I decided to order the same vitamin without iron and havent had any issues since...its just a shame they dont offer with non-constipating iron especially because iron is one of the main vitamins he needs right now.
customer_reviews.author: Mo0nlitstr

customer_reviews.title: Great taste!
customer_reviews.text: I've been giving it to my breastfeeding baby since he was 5 months old and he loves it. I did alot of research prior to buying this and trust me it's better to spend a little more than to get something cheaper that upsets your little ones tummy. My son takes it with no problem and he loves the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper on their site and gave my baby an allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended this multivitamin and I purchased it through here thinking it'd be cheaper only to find out later it wasn't! It also is unrelated with the quality of the product or seller, but it gave my daughter an allergic reaction (diarrhea and fussiness) which the doctor said wasn't normal for a product with iron and to discontinue use, after which she got better. For us, the cons outweighed the pros.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs Masterson

customer_reviews.title: This stuff STAINS!
customer_reviews.text: How does a person evaluate a vitamin? I don't know... But I'm evaluating their dye-free claim. DO NOT think this means that it won't stain. Whatever is naturally in this will stain like you wouldn't believe. Only give this to a naked baby...in the bath...will full tarping on you and the room. Be warned!
customer_reviews.author: N. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Toddler likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Toddler always struggled with poly vi sol w/ iron. I decided to make the switch and I’m glad we did! She doesn’t fuss over it anymore - in fact she seems to enjoy the taste! I’m ordering the next bottle soon 😄
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Khan

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves the taste!
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure about purchasing this for my daughter because I normally use Zarbees but I was forced to try something else due to the fact I can't find it anywhere. My daughter is a very picky eater and does not like to take meds (vitamins) but she likes this brand just as much as she does Zarbee's. We tried other supplements with no luck and I am happy to find another multivitamin she likes.
customer_reviews.author: leslie

customer_reviews.title: Hemoglobin levels UP
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Around 9 mos, my daughter had slightly low hemoglobin levels, but I didn't want to feed her rice cereal, so I bought this. Her levels are right where they should be now and she loves the taste! She thinks it's a "treat".
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Forni

customer_reviews.title: Very good for my 2 yr old toddler
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I am so greatful for this product right here I'll purchase more when this one is finished, really helped as my 2 yr old daughter does not eat a lot but this really helps. I like that she getting her nutrients now. Thanks!! lol my daughter refuse to take anything so I just put it in her drink and she has no idea. Lol!! Not suppose to do that but it's multivitamin. Thanks guys, cuz I was a bit worried when the doctor told me her iron was low...
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Don’t like new Dropper
customer_reviews.text: Been getting this product for over a year and have loved it. My most recent purchase the company changed the dropper that is used to measure the amount of vitamin you give and the change is horrible. The dropper used to function as a bottle cap but now it’s just a dropper and when you’re done with the dropper you have to replace the bottle top with another cap. Please go back to original dropper.
customer_reviews.author: Satwinder Kaur

customer_reviews.title: Great vitamins, but stains.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my little one! The only reason I gave these vitamins 4 stars instead of 5 is because the vitamins stain if my little one drools shortly after taking them. I've begun to give them to him while he's in the bath to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: HuskiesGal

customer_reviews.title: Taste is bad
customer_reviews.text: I added it to my breastmilk to give it to my kid, and it didn't mix completely. The taste is really bad, I have thrown it away.
customer_reviews.author: Tam Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: WAAYYY better than Enfamil drops.
customer_reviews.text: I give this to my now 4 month old and he drinks it without making any faces. I add this to breast milk in a bottle and the milk dilutes the sweet taste. It is good to give just as a supplement as well. I tried the emfamil drops and they tasted and smelled horrible. My son would spit it out every time. I was worried when I bought this if it would work and now I am highly satisfied with my purchase. Will continue buying it.
customer_reviews.author: M.N

customer_reviews.title: Toddler approved
customer_reviews.text: Before this product we tried Enfamil and it was disgusting. I always taste test prior to giving anything to my child and I hated it. Still tried to give it to my toddler and he fought me everytime. Happy to say, I tried this vitamin and he happily takes it and actually looks forward to it! The formula also doesn't taste sugary or smell.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: Baby (13 months now) is happy to open up and take her vitamins! After each day's dose, she looks at the bottle expectantly as I put it away, as if she wants more. This is in sharp contrast with her friend (same age) that simply refuses to open his mouth for the Enfamil multi. Yes, it could just be a difference in personalities, but it seems like I'm not the only one who's baby digs the flavor of this. Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Carleton

customer_reviews.title: Best Flavor!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to my son who was at that time 13 Months old. His Dr recommended Poly-Vi-Sol but it taste awful and it was always a fuss trying to give him his daily doses. Big game change after trying this brand because my son it’s willing to take it without any fuss. I totally recommend this product, it doesn’t stink and the flavor it’s as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda B

customer_reviews.title: Smell good
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old boy loves this one. I bought another brand before, but it's too sour. The smell is so good so my picky little no longer refuses taking it.
customer_reviews.author: Quyen Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: i liked it she didnt
customer_reviews.text: i used it for my daughter when she was an infant, she wasnt the biggest fan. the taste is not the best. but its quality is great. shes happy now we upgraded to gummies since shes older, i would recommend because it is a great product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What's up with the dropper?!
customer_reviews.text: The product itself I believe is great. However, this is my 6th bottle and suddenly they dont have a screw on dropper? Super inconvenient. I actually spilled 3/4 of the bottle bc I had to futz with the stupid tiny dropper that doesn't even fill to the .5ml line with each squeeze.
customer_reviews.author: AliRyan

customer_reviews.title: Taste is not great
customer_reviews.text: Taste isn't great. I tasted first - after I smelled the strong iron smell. It definitely tastes like licking metal...but it does work. So chase it with a sweet treat or food to wash the flavor away.
customer_reviews.author: Peter James Epler

customer_reviews.title: Finally an iron supplement that doesn't taste terrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few different multivitamins with iron for my infant son and he's hated them all. He would spit them right out or refused to open his mouth. After so much money wasted, I'm so glad I found this one! My baby will take it, with no problems! It has a good amount of iron, as well as some other essential vitamins (A, E D and some Bs). I just wish it was a more comprehensive multivitamin. That said, the most important thing is that it has iron and doesn't taste terrible- so that alone is earning a 5 star rating from me. I'm a happy mama! :)
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Doctor approved
customer_reviews.text: Our pediatrician specifically recommended this product for our breastfed baby over 6 months (apparently by then they’ve sapped mom of her iron) and our very picky baby swallowed it without too much fuss, just a bit of a sour face and a flavor shiver. Dropper is easy to use, works well. I actually vastly preferred this to the vitamin D drops which I thought were hard to give in the right amount
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M.

customer_reviews.title: Very stupid design
customer_reviews.text: Look at other review, this looks like a common problem and the design is not consistent. Very disappointment that this is even the Amazon choice one. Why?
customer_reviews.author: Lulala

customer_reviews.title: Breastfeeding Baby loves!
customer_reviews.text: My first priority was to have the very best ingredients, and secondly something my 6 month old would take... this checks both boxes! I tried another brand first and it tasted awful, this actually tastes a little fruity and much better in my opinion. Great option for breastfeeding babies starting finger foods/baby led weaning!
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyQ80

customer_reviews.title: Real expensive but good results.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how they make it, but it's expensive in my opinion. However this one taste better than other brands. The main reason is my baby can tolerate this taste better. So I just bite the bullet and buy these instead.
customer_reviews.author: Thavychu

customer_reviews.title: Essential vitamin for young kids!
customer_reviews.text: Took a few weeks for my children to get used to the taste. Started my 1 year old and 3 year old on this vitamin after my 1 year old’s iron levels were low. I quickly noticed a big change in both kids. They were sleeping better at night, trying new foods at mealtime, and were overall more energetic and happier kids. I would recommend this vitamin to anyone with small children!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonphene

customer_reviews.title: Great Investent
customer_reviews.text: My breastfed baby needed these vitamins and originally had a different brand but it made him gag and was really tough to get him to take it, but this YUM brand he actually enjoyed and it made it so muhc easier and less messy when time to give it to him.
customer_reviews.author: yana

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids who need iron
customer_reviews.text: It does not taste great but I put it in flavored water and my little one will take it. Better than the chewables and easier for him to digest
customer_reviews.author: Ami Wright

customer_reviews.title: Good natural option for infant multivitamin
customer_reviews.text: My infant twins were prescribed multivitmain and iron supplements. The ones they were given were horrible, smelled and tasted bad. The ingredients also included dyes, which did not make any sense to me. I scoured the internet and realized there were very few natural options for infant multivitamins. I went with Novaferrum, It's a more natural multivitamin and includes the same levels of supplements as the other vitamins. It is not smelly and has a mildly pleasant flavor. My babies no longer gag nor spit up the milk I mix the vitamins in.
customer_reviews.author: Misha011

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: Recommended to me by my daughters pedi. My 8 month old takes this easily and doesn’t seem to mind the taste, even though I think it tastes pretty nasty! Also, I swear her poops/gas never smelled until she started using this stuff.... ick.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to polyvisol!
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to polyvisol! It was a battle to get my infant to take her vitamins and I would eventually find stains on her skin after the fact. It smells way better too! The price is double polyvisol but she’s loved taking this since we switched. I give her two 0.5ml doses before bedtime and it’s like a treat to her, she enjoys it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Toddler hated the taste
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed by how much of a dud this was -- it came highly recommended, but my toddler hated the taste and cried whenever she saw me approaching with this vitamin. I tasted it myself and found it really unpleasant.
customer_reviews.author: LollyDa

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: My kids have loved these vitamins, since age 6 months and up! My daughter is now too and ask for it by name every morning. Have never had an issue with them taking it, they love it. One thing I learned is that when you give it to a younger baby, make sure they wear a bib because some will inevitably drip out and it does stain because of the iron. Overall very happy with this product and I've ordered it many times. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Currier

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these vitamins! The first time she was unsure(probably because she was only 5 months and had not had any food yet so the flavor was new) but quickly loved them. She gets excited when she sees the bottle! Only downside is that the vitamins are dark brown and stain clothing. I have to dab her mouth with a paper towel when giving them to her to prevent getting on clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie E.

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Smells absolutely terrible. Its greasy thick iodine brown goop. It stains and impregnates everything it drops and spills on. Destroys clothing. Getting the baby to take it is a nightmare . It tastes like old orange peels.
customer_reviews.author: MAGNETIC THUNDER

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hide in foods for picky eaters
customer_reviews.text: If you're buying this, or considering, chances are your kid is picky. My son has a very limited diet, so finding something that can be hidden in the foods he eats has been really challenging! I hide this on his toast and it works great! The taste is mild enough where he doesn't notice it, small volume so it's easier to handle than a 5 mL serving. Just bought my second bottle. We use one serving a day and it's lasted 8 - 9 weeks. I'm sure we've missed a couple days but for $20 and he actually eats it - worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: My 1 year old actually asks for her vitamins now!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic alternative to the usual liquid vitamins for babies. My 1 year old is too young for regular vitamins or gummies and could detect the Poly-vi-sol vitamins in her food (she rejected everything but solids at 10 months). She likes the flavor so much that she vibrates (her excited reaction to things) when she sees the vitamin bottle and points to it while babbling away - great side effect, she actually reminds me to give her a dose of vitamins every day. What mom wouldn't love her baby helping her to remember the vitamins? Just wish these were available at a local retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Krugers

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but not the best out there
customer_reviews.text: Was able to hide it in my toddlers milk but the dropper is inconvenient having to wash it with every use.. and the bottle leaks laying down even in a ziplock..good news is it washes and wipes off fabrics easily..
customer_reviews.author: sinatra69

customer_reviews.title: Great vitamin for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried almost every multi vitamin on the market for my toddler & she loves this one. It has all the essential vitamins and the taste isn’t bad (I tried some before giving them to her). It comes with a dropper that fits into the cap so it makes everything easier.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: everything is good except the dropper
customer_reviews.text: The product is nice but the dropper is not really good
customer_reviews.author: ktsg

customer_reviews.title: Updated Lid/Dropper. Best liquid MVI.
customer_reviews.text: They finally did it! They put a dropper in that fits on the top as the lid. We love this product as my son would fight me on any other liquid vitamin we tried. As it does have iron in it, beware of staining clothes (we give right after dinner while he still has a bib on). It also may stain teeth, but if brushing your child’s teeth 2 times per day with fluoride toothpaste (recommended as soon as teeth come in) you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Walker

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: My baby hates her poly-v-sol and I'm so happy I found this one. I mixed it in her puree. One thing I don't like is the dropper. It's hard to use. And the price is almost 3 times more expensive than poly-v-sol.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe C

product_meta.title: NovaFerrum Multivitamin with Iron for Infants and Toddlers
feature_bullets: PROVEN IN A CLINICAL TRIAL: NovaFerrum has been clinically proven to be Safe, Well Tolerated, and Effective at raising iron levels. It also showed that there was High Compliance – basically, Kids will take it. (JAMA June 13, 2017 Volume 317, Number 22)
NO BAD STUFF: NovaFerrum Does Not contain Gluten, Sugar, Alcohol, Parabens, Synthetic Colors, or Caffeine.
NATURAL FRUIT EXTRACTS: NovaFerum Does contain Natural fruit flavors and Natural fruit sweeteners.
GREAT TASTING: NovaFerrum has a pleasant taste that kids will enjoy, without the yucky taste of iron.
GOOD HEALTH: An excellent source of iron made from Polysaccharide-Iron Complex. One bottle contains 50 servings. It can be dispensed directly or you can mix with formula or juice.
